alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 10:21AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Franklin and Osage. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding across the area and numerous road closures. Between 3 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ottawa, Osage City, Lyndon, Centropolis, Pomona, Williamsburg, Quenemo, Melvern, Princeton, Reading, Olivet, Pomona Lake and Melvern Lake. - This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 158 and 190.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
